com.wm.app.b2b.client

Class Context

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wm.app.b2b.client.BaseContext
      • com.wm.app.b2b.client.Context
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    JSONClient

    public class Context
extends BaseContext
    The com.wm.app.b2b.client package contains the classes necessary to establish client connectivity to a webMethods Integration Server. Client to Server communications are carried out via HTTP POSTs in either a binary or XML encoding.

    Provides session management (with pinger), applet support, and threadedInvokes.

      • Context

        public Context()
        Create a new unconnected Client Context and default to a binary RPC transport.

      • Context

        public Context(int rpcType)
        Create a new unconnected Client Context utilizing the specified RPC type. Valid RPC types are:
        • Context.RPC_BIN
        • Context.RPC_XML
        Parameters:
        rpcType - RPC type to use.

      • Context

        public Context(java.applet.Applet a)
        throws ServiceException
        Create a new Client Context and specify that the client is running as an Applet. Note that the Context is automatically connected to the server specified by applet <PARAM> tags. Applets are uniquely constrained so this constructor must be used by clients which are applets. Not doing so will result in network security exceptions.

        Valid <PARAM> attributes are:

        SERVERServer endpoint in the form host:port
        SERVERUSERUser to log in as
        SERVERPASSUser's password
        SECUREBoolean to select SSL or not. Values: true or false
        DEBUGSet debug level. Values: 0-10
        FIXEDURIFor running clients that access Integration servers through web servers with the CGI-gateway
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • invokeThreaded

        public InvokeThread invokeThreaded(NSName svcName,
                                   Values data)
        Calls invoke asynchronously and returns an InvokeThread. The getData method can then be called on the returned InvokeThread to retrieve the call results. The invoke retries the service invocation when a transient connection failure occurs.
        Parameters:
        svcName - Service namespace name
        data - input data for the service invocation
        See Also:
        invoke

      • invokeThreaded

        public InvokeThread invokeThreaded(java.lang.String ifc,
                                   java.lang.String svc,
                                   Values data)
        Calls invoke asynchronously and returns an InvokeThread. The getData method can then be called on the returned InvokeThread to retrieve the call results. The invoke retries the service invocation when a transient connection failure occurs.
        Parameters:
        ifc - Interface name of the service to invoke
        svc - service to invoke
        data - input data for the service invocation
        See Also:
        invoke

      • invoke

        public Values invoke(NSName svcName,
                     Values data)
              throws ServiceException
        Makes a call to the Integration Server to invoke the specified functionality. connect() must be called first or the call will fail. The invoke retries the service invocation when a transient connection failure occurs.
        Parameters:
        svcName - Service Namespace Name
        data - Service input data
        Returns:
        Values object of service invocation results.
        Throws:
        ServiceException

        Parameters:
        ifc - Target Interface
        svc - Target Service
        data - Service input data
        Returns:

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
                    int port,
                    java.lang.String user,
                    java.lang.String pass)
             throws ServiceException
        Connects the Context to an Integration Server and establishes session state on the server. If supplied, it also sets user credentials.
        Parameters:
        host - hostName of Server endpoint.
        port - part of Server endpoint --=* optional parameters *=--
        user - User to connect as
        pass - User's password
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • connect

        public final void connect(java.lang.String server,
                          java.lang.String user,
                          java.lang.String pass)
                   throws ServiceException
        Connects the Context to an Integration Server and establishes session state on the server. If supplied, it also sets user credentials.
        Parameters:
        server - Server endpoint in the form: host:port --=* optional parameters *=--
        user - User to connect as
        pass - User's password
        Throws:

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String server)
             throws ServiceException
        Connects this Context to an Integration Server and establishes session state on the server.
        Parameters:
        server - Server endpoint in the form: host:port
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String server,
                    byte[] certificate)
             throws ServiceException
        Connects the Context to a Integration Server and establishes session state on the server. The byte image of the certificate can be obtained via a call to getCertificate(). Authentication with this certificate is performed at the application layer and is independent of certificates used to establish secure connections like SSL.
        Parameters:
        server - Server endpoint in the form: host:port
        certificate - byte image of X.509 certificate to submit
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getCookiesAsArray

        public java.lang.String[] getCookiesAsArray()
        Returns the values of the Set-Cookie headers from the previous response in an array of Strings.

      • setCookie

        public void setCookie(java.lang.String cookie)
        Sets the HTTP cookie to be used with the next service invocation. By default, the cookie will be set to the session ID. Use this method to set the cookie to a different value. If null is passed to setCookie, Context.invoke will set the cookie to the session ID.

        If a response contains a Set-Cookie header field and you want to set the cookie in the next invoke to that entire value, you can use getCookieAsArray and setCookie: 

         String[] cookies = context.getCookiesAsarray();
 StringBuilder cookie = new StringBuilder();
 for (String cookieVal : cookies) {
     cookie.append(cookieVal);
     cookie.append("; ");
 }
 cookie.setLength(cookie.getLength()-2); // remove trailing "; "
 context.setCookie(cookie.toString());
        Parameters:
        cookie - The value of the Cookie header to be used in the next service invocation.

      • cleanUpConnection

        public void cleanUpConnection()
        Cleanup when a connection has been lost. Similar to disconnect(), except invoking wm.server/disconnect is not necessary.
